body_html: It looks like the problem still exists in pytorch 0.4 and python 3.6. Not sure if it is a pytorch problem. I use opencv and set num_workers=8, pin_memory=True. I try all the tricks mentioned above and setting cv2.setNumThreads(0) solves my problem.
body_text: It looks like the problem still exists in pytorch 0.4 and python 3.6. Not sure if it is a pytorch problem. I use opencv and set num_workers=8, pin_memory=True. I try all the tricks mentioned above and setting cv2.setNumThreads(0) solves my problem.
body: It looks like the problem still exists in pytorch 0.4 and python 3.6. Not sure if it is a pytorch problem. I use opencv and set `num_workers=8`, `pin_memory=True`. I try all the tricks mentioned above and setting `cv2.setNumThreads(0)` solves my problem.
